activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#249
activity.text:
@rithviknishad for the updation script 

can I go for a change in load-fixtures.sh or create a new one?

: "${FIXTURES_SOURCE:=https://github.com/coronasafe/leaderboard-data.git}"

rm -rf data-repo
mkdir data-repo
cd data-repo

git init
git remote add --mirror=fetch origin ${FIXTURES_SOURCE}
git config core.sparseCheckout true

echo "data/" >> .git/info/sparse-checkout
echo "contributors/" >> .git/info/sparse-checkout
echo "tailwind.config.js" >> .git/info/sparse-checkout

git pull origin main

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#249
activity.text: Okay, you are trying to say that,  rather than creating a GUI for setting up custom color palettes, the system could rely on configuration files or environment variables that the engineer can modify directly. right?

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#249
activity.text: @rithviknishad Okay, I think  One way to achieve this is by providing a user interface where organizations can input their custom color values.

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#249
activity.text:
### Themes suggestion:

**Techy Blue Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #0366d6 (Blue)
Secondary Accent Color: #24292e (Dark Gray)
Neutral Color: #f6f8fa (Light Gray)
Text Color: #24292e (Dark Gray)

**Data-driven Green Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #28a745 (Green)
Secondary Accent Color: #6cb2eb (Light Blue)
Neutral Color: #f8f9fa (Off-White)
Text Color: #333333 (Dark Gray)

**Code-friendly Dark Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #6f42c1 (Purple)
Secondary Accent Color: #586069 (Gray)
Neutral Color: #1e1e1e (Dark Gray)
Text Color: #e1e4e8 (Light Gray)

**Corporate Navy Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #0366d6 (Navy Blue)
Secondary Accent Color: #586069 (Gray)
Neutral Color: #f6f8fa (Light Gray)
Text Color: #24292e (Dark Gray)

**Minimalistic Monochrome Theme:**
Primary Accent Color: #333333 (Dark Gray)
Secondary Accent Color: #666666 (Medium Gray)
Neutral Color: #f8f9fa (Off-White)
Text Color: #24292e (Dark Gray)

@rithviknishad Hey, I think it is the best theme .5 themes are good number ?
